DataElement.preferredName: Health Care Provider Hepatitis Notification Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the type of hepatitis that you have when notified by your healthcare provider.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.:Inflammation of the liver; usually from a viral infection, but sometimes from toxic agents._Informing by words.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities, or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

Concepts.definition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

Property.preferredDefinition: Inflammation of the liver; usually from a viral infection, but sometimes from toxic agents._Informing by words.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of the liver; usually from a viral infection, but sometimes from toxic agents.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 2023.1.31 Released per review. ak2022.12.27 Created for ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A non-taxonomic classification of unrelated viruses that cause liver inflammation and dysfunction._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A single stranded RNA virus.  A member of the picornaviridae family, subfamily hepatovirus.  The causative agent of Hepatitis A.

Concepts.definition: A single stranded RNA virus.  A member of the picornaviridae family, subfamily hepatovirus.  The causative agent of Hepatitis A.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) is the prototype of the Hepadnavirus Family.  Included in the family are the Woodchuck Hepatitis Virus (WHV) and the Duck Hepatitis B Virus (DHBV) which provide animal models of infection.  The HBV genome is a partially double stranded circular DNA.  A viral reverse transcriptase is bound to the 5' extremity of the long strand.

Concepts.definition: Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) is the prototype of the Hepadnavirus Family.  Included in the family are the Woodchuck Hepatitis Virus (WHV) and the Duck Hepatitis B Virus (DHBV) which provide animal models of infection.  The HBV genome is a partially double stranded circular DNA.  A viral reverse transcriptase is bound to the 5' extremity of the long strand.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame.

Concepts.definition: A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The answer is not known by the person answering.

Concepts.definition: The answer is not known by the person answering.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A non-taxonomic classification of unrelated viruses that cause liver inflammation and dysfunction._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A non-taxonomic classification of unrelated viruses that cause liver inflammation and dysfunction.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
